required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Boroda Supramolecular Active Zinc in the Treatment of Scalp Psoriasis
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Single-blind, Parallel-controlled Clinical Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Boroda Supramolecular Active Zinc in the Treatment of Scalp Psoriasis

brief_summary.textblock:
A multicenter, randomized, single-blind, parallel-controlled clinical study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of boroda supramolecular active zinc in the treatment of scalp psoriasis.
Main objective:：Compare the efficacy of boroda supramolecular active zinc and capotetriol liniment in the treatment of scalp psoriasis Secondary objective: To observe the safety of boroda supramolecular active zinc in the treatment of subjects with scalp psoriasis

primary_outcome.measure: Success rate at the end of treatment (4th week) in each group (percentage of patients with overall score of < 1)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change of success rate from baseline at 4 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The overall criteria for assessing the severity of disease for researchers are a static skin scoring system consisting of six levels (score of 0-5) of change from "disappearance" to "very serious" diseases. The main endpoint of the overall assessment criteria for disease severity according to the researchers will be "disease control", defined as "disappearance (score of 0) " or "extreme mild (score of 1) " disease grade at the end of treatment. At the end of treatment, the proportion of the subjects who are evaluated as disease under control (signs disappeared and extremely mild) by "the overall assessment of the severity of disease by researchers" base on observation. Comparing the disease control rates among the groups can reflect the differentiation treatment efficacy.

primary_outcome.measure: The clinical signs of psoriasis (erythema, infiltration, and scaly) (The Total sign score (TSS))
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change of sclinical signs of psoriasis from baseline at 4 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Scoring each symptom once on the basis of the five-point system given below can assess the average severity of all scalp lesions. 0 = no sign = Mild = Medium = Severity = Extremely severe At the end of treatment, researchers need to evaluate scalp psoriasis in all subjects from three aspects: erythema, infiltration and scales. The percentage of remission per clinical sign (erythema, infiltration, scales) in each group (percentage of patients with clinical score = 0).

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation criteria of pruritus symptoms in the subjects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of spruritus symptoms from baseline at 4 weeks

arm_group.description: Boleda Supramolecular Active Zinc (Shanghai Ruizhi Pharmaceutical Technology Co., Ltd.): 30ml/bottle. Once a day for 4 weeks, apply topically to the scalp psoriasis area, gently massage for 15 minutes then rinse off with warm water.
30ml/bottle. Two times a day for 4 weeks, topically applied to scalp psoriasis.
30ml/bottle. Once a day for 4 weeks, apply topically to the scalp psoriasis area, gently massage for 15 minutes then rinse off with warm water.

intervention.description: Boleda Supramolecular Active Zinc Conditioner (Shanghai Ruizhi Pharmaceutical Technology Co., Ltd.): 30ml/bottle. Once a day for 4 weeks, apply topically to the scalp psoriasis area, gently massage for 15 minutes then rinse off with warm water.
Capotetriol scalp solution: 30ml/bottle. Two times a day for 4 weeks, topically applied to scalp psoriasis.

Supramolecular Hydrogel (Shanghai Ruizhi Pharmaceutical Technology Co., Ltd.): 30ml/bottle. Once a day for 4 weeks, apply topically to the scalp psoriasis area, gently massage for 15 minutes then rinse off with warm water.
